title: 2024 albums of the year - the not-quite-but-still-good runners-up

summary: I posted this over at Bluesky and I thought it was worth asking here as well, because it was a real thing that happened to me: One day I disdained the idea of socks as a gift, and then it feels like literally the next I was all “Oh Hell YEAH socks” whenever new ones […]
title: The Sock Flip

summary: Really interesting research into the structure of prime numbers.  Not immediately related to the cryptanalysis of prime-number-based public-key algorithms, but every little bit matters.
title: New Advances in the Understanding of Prime Numbers

summary:
> LINK · 'More than 140 Kenya Facebook moderators diagnosed with severe PTSD' on ThE Guardian

The case is shedding light on the human cost of the boom in social media use in recent years that has required more and more moderation, often in some of the poorest parts of the world, to protect users from the worst material that some people post.
title: > Outsourced Facebook moderation results in severe PTSD

summary: A parental request embarked author Chris Gerrib on a new literary adventure, one without spaceships or flights of fantasy.  How did that adventure turn out.  The author explains all in this Big Idea for his latest novel, Strawberry Gold...
title: The Big Idea: Chris Gerrib

summary: Often learning is more fun when you have something “fun” to learn for.  If you are like me, you may enjoy spinning up new projects to learn various Docker skills and disciplines.  However, having a home lab project that is fun in itself makes this process even more enjoyable...
title: Docker Minecraft Server Home Lab Project

summary: Adam Griffin is still in disbelief over how quickly he was robbed of nearly $500,000 in cryptocurrencies.  A scammer called using a real Google phone number to warn his Gmail account was being hacked, sent email security alerts directly from google. com, and ultimately seized control over the account by convincing him to click "yes" to a Google prompt on his mobile device
title: How to Lose a Fortune with Just One Bad Click

summary: Will Moore, who recently joined our team as Communications Lead, shares how he came to enjoy Tailscale after a sometimes-frustrating history with networking tech
title: If I can get Tailscale to work, so can you

summary:
Oppose digital IDs – they break the law and lead to mass scale surveillance
Published: Dec 18, 2024

Starting next year, the UK government plans to introduce digital ID cards for the young people to prove their age when visiting pubs.  While officials claim this system will remain optional, it's part of a broader government initiative to move more state functions online so that people can prove their identity for everything from paying taxes to opening a bank account using the government-backed app.  This will be a step toward a society where every pub visit, purchase, and social interaction becomes a permanent digital record linked to a government-issued ID – a step to normalizing mass surveillance at scale...
title: Oppose digital IDs – they break the law and lead to mass scale surveillance
